abstract: New York Mets general manager Sandy Alderson reaches compromise with pitcher Matt Harvey and his agent Scott Boras on number of innings Harvey will play in regular season; remains vague as to whether Harvey will be included in postseason rotation; Harvey announces intention to continue pitching if team makes playoffs.
lead_paragraph: Alderson, the general manager, discussed a plan with Harvey that would keep him in the rotation, but whether it passes muster with Scott Boras, Harvey’s forceful agent, remains to be seen.

headline.main: Sandy Alderson Proposes Compromise for Mets’ Matt Harvey
headline.print_headline: Alderson Proposes Flexible Compromise for Harvey

snippet: Alderson, the general manager, discussed a plan with Harvey that would keep him in the rotation, but whether it passes muster with Scott Boras, Harvey’s forceful agent, remains to be seen.
